publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2141 Lord James Douglas-Hamilton: Scottish Parliament Police Unit—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to reimburse Lothian and Borders Police for the full annual cost of running the Scottish Parliament Police Unit, instead of the current 39 week basis of reimbursement which will result in a funding deficit of £111,436 in the current financial year, as the costs of policing the Parliament should be borne centrally and not at the expense of one region of the country. Supported by: David McLetchie*, Fiona Hyslop*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-2141 Scottish Parliament Police Unit (lodged on 30 August 2001) Shona Robison*
S1M-2141 Scottish Parliament Police Unit (lodged on 30 August 2001) Alex Neil*, Margaret Smith*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-2141 Scottish Parliament Police Unit (lodged on 30 August 2001) Mary Scanlon*, Ms Sandra White*

S1M-2141 Lord James Douglas-Hamilton: Scottish Parliament Police Unit-That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to reimburse Lothian and Borders Police for the full annual cost of running the Scottish Parliament Police Unit, instead of the current 39 week basis of reimbursement which will result in a funding deficit of £111,436 in the current financial year, as the costs of policing the Parliament should be borne centrally and not at the expense of one region of the country. Supported by: David McLetchie, Fiona Hyslop, Linda Fabiani, Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Margaret Smith, Tricia Marwick, Mary Scanlon, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2141 Scottish Parliament Police Unit (lodged on 30 August 2001) Christine Grahame*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-2141 Scottish Parliament Police Unit (lodged on 30 August 2001) Mr Brian Monteith*, Michael Russell*
S1M-2141 Scottish Parliament Police Unit (lodged on 30 August 2001) Alex Fergusson*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*

S1M-2141 Lord James Douglas-Hamilton: Scottish Parliament Police Unit—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to reimburse Lothian and Borders Police for the full annual cost of running the Scottish Parliament Police Unit, instead of the current 39 week basis of reimbursement which will result in a funding deficit of £111,436 in the current financial year, as the costs of policing the Parliament should be borne centrally and not at the expense of one region of the country. Supported by: David McLetchie, Fiona Hyslop, Linda Fabiani, Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Margaret Smith, Tricia Marwick, Mary Scanlon, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Andrew Wilson, Mr Brian Monteith, Michael Russell, Alex Fergusson, Mr Jamie McGrigor
S1M-2141 Scottish Parliament Police Unit (lodged on 30 August 2001) Mr Gil Paterson*

Supported by: David McLetchie, Fiona Hyslop, Linda Fabiani, Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Margaret Smith, Tricia Marwick, Mary Scanlon, Ms Sandra White, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Andrew Wilson, Mr Brian Monteith, Michael Russell, Alex Fergusson, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr Gil Paterson
